message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper proposes an enhanced precoding scheme for multi-user multi-layer MIMO systems, which involves incorporating the MIMO receiver structure into the precoder design procedure. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category, which deals with the study of communication systems and their theoretical foundations. Additionally, the paper focuses on improving system performance by balancing the layer signal power and layer interference power, which suggests that it may also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category, which deals with the design and analysis of communication networks. The paper may also belong to the Signal Processing (cs.SI) sub-category, which deals with the analysis and manipulation of signals, as well as the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category, which deals with the processing and analysis of multimedia data. Finally, the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category, which deals with the development of algorithms and models for learning from data, as the proposed scheme involves optimizing the precoder design.
